class: middle
# What you won’t learn?

* Big data

* Python, Julia, and friends

* Non-rectangular data e.g., images, sounds, trees, and text

* Hypothesis confirmation
---
class: middle
# Prerequisites

* Some programing experience <sup>1</sup>

* There are four things you need to run the code in this book:
  - R. go to CRAN, the comprehensive R archive network
  
  - RStudio. An [IDE](http://www.rstudio.com/download), for R programming.
  
  - A collection of R packages called the tidyverse.
```
    install.packages("tidyverse")
    library(tidyverse)
```

  - Other packages. e.g.,
```
    install.packages(c("nycflights13", "gapminder", "Lahman"))
```

.footnote[
[1] New to programming? see [Hands on Programming with R](https://www.amazon.com/dp/1449359019/ref=cm_sw_su_dp) by Garrett
]
